page.title: 17A Typical Day At School
page.content: A day at school usually starts at 9'0'clock in the morning.We go into the Hall for an Assembly and we sing hymns and say our prayers. After Assembly we go into the class and read or talk to each other. When Mr Kings comes in he tells us what to do.For example he may tell us to do Primary Mathematics so we would get the books out of our desks and get started.At half past ten we have a break and go outside to play.At quarter to eleven we come in and we might have something else to do, otherwise we get on with what we were doing before play. At midday we have our lunch in the Hall and then we go outside to play until one'o'clock.We go back to our classroom to do something else,like English Comprehension or Hesse Maths. At quarter past two we go outside for
